text: Muhammad Afzal Ahsan Randhawa (, 1 September 1937 â€“ 18 September 2017) was a Pakistani Punjabi language writer, poet, translator, playwright and a politician. He authored several short stories and novels in the Punjabi language including Sooraj Grehan and Doaba. He received the Pride of Performance and Kamal-e-Fun awards for his literary work. On the evening of 18 September 2017, Randhawa died at the age of 80 in Faisalabad, Pakistan. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Pakistani writers Category:Politicians from Punjab, Pakistan Category:Playwrights Category:Pakistani poets Category:Translators
title: Afzal Ahsan Randhawa
